page.title: 10A HOSPITAL IN KILMARNOCK
page.content: {Kirklandside Hospital}was built in 1910. It is a{Geriatric Hospital. There are 109 staff employed. Thirty-four of the staff are full-time and seventy-five are part-time. The staff in the hospital is composed of trained and untrained nurses, domestics, catering and porters. In the hospital there are four wards. The day we visited it,there were 107 patients. Since it can actually accomodate 108, it was therefore more or less full. The most common illness is general debility. There are no operating theatres. If people are very ill, they go to other hospitals for operations. According to the staff the hospital is not very well equipped. The head porter looks after the grounds, which seemed very pleasant.
